citation.article-title: Winogradskyella rapida sp. nov., isolated from protein-enriched seawater
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Winogradskyella rapida sp. nov.
Winogradskyella rapida (ra.pi′da. L. fem. adj. rapida fast, referring to the capacity for rapid growth in protein-enriched seawater).
Cells are 0.3–0.4 μm in diameter and 0.8–1.8 μm long.
Colonies on MA are round, 2–3 mm in diameter and light-yellow-pigmented with a shiny surface.
Na+ ions are required for growth.
Grows with 1–8 % NaCl (optimum 2–3 %) and at 4–36 °C (optimum 23–25 °C). β-Galactosidase-negative.
Hydrogen sulfide is produced but indole and acetoin (Voges–Proskauer reaction) are not produced.
Casein, gelatin, starch and Tweens 20, 40 and 80 are hydrolysed but agar, DNA, urea, cellulose (CM-cellulose and filter paper) and chitin are not hydrolysed.

Acid is produced from d-glucose, maltose, d-fructose, glycerol and mannitol, but not from l-arabinose, cellobiose, d-galactose, lactose, melibiose, raffinose, l-rhamnose, sucrose, l-sorbose, trehalose, dl-xylose, N-acetylglucosamine, adonitol, dulcitol, inositol, sorbitol or citrate.
d-Mannose is utilized, but l-arabinose, lactose, inositol and sorbitol are not.

According to the API ZYM gallery (bioMérieux), acid and alkaline phosphatases, esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), lipase (C14), leucine, valine and cystine arylamidases, trypsin, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase and α-glucosidase activities are present, but α-chymotrypsin, α- and β-galactosidases, β-glucuronidase, β-glucosidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, α-mannosidase and α-fucosidase activities are absent.
Susceptible to ampicillin, carbenicillin, chloramphenicol, doxycycline, erythromycin, lincomycin, oleandomycin and tetracycline.
Resistant to benzylpenicillin, gentamicin, kanamycin, neomycin, polymyxin B and streptomycin.
The main cellular fatty acids are antesio-C15 : 0, iso-C15 : 0, iso-C15 : 0 3-OH, iso-C15 : 1 and iso-C17 : 0 3-OH.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 36.3 mol%.
The type strain, SCB36T (=CECT 7392T =CCUG 56098T), was isolated from a protein-enriched surface seawater sample from Scripps Pier (La Jolla, CA, USA), in the Eastern Pacific Ocean.
